title: Peru’s Castillo to Serve Three Years of Pre-Trial Detention
description: Recently ousted former Peruvian President Pedro Castillo was given three years of pre-trial detention on Thursday for allegedly working to rig public works contracts while in office.

title: Xi Poised to Complete Ascension With Third Term as China’s President
description: China is expected to hand Xi Jinping a third term as president when the roughly 3,000 members of its rubber-stamp legislature vote Friday, completing his ascension as supreme leader of the world’s No. 2 economy.

title: SeatGeek, Paciolan Sent Queries in DOJ’s Ticketmaster Antitrust Probe
description: The Justice Department’s antitrust lawyers have sought information from at least two rivals of Live Nation Entertainment Inc.’s Ticketmaster as part of a probe into the company’s dominance in the ticketing industry, according to people familiar with the probe.

title: The Aftermath of Covid Zero: China’s Reversal Tests Trust in Xi’s Rule
description: After imposing three years of sacrifice, Xi Jinping’s government let Covid tear through the population in two months. Moving on won’t be easy.

title: Biden to Meet With Trudeau, Address Canadian Parliament in Late March Visit
description: US President Joe Biden will address the Canadian Parliament and meet with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to discuss Ukraine, Haiti, and protecting North American airspace after the incursion by an alleged Chinese spy balloon during a visit later this month.

title: US Eyes China Competition in Indo-Pacific With Budget Boost for Pentagon
description: The Biden administration’s proposed budget for the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1 asks for billions more dollars to boost its Indo-Pacific military command, enhance missile defense and strengthen regional economies, as part of a broader push to counter China’s more assertive role in the region.

title: FTC Votes to Block ICE-Black Knight Deal, Citing Higher Prices for Home Buyers
description: The Federal Trade Commission sued to block Intercontinental Exchange Inc. proposed acquisition of mortgage software rival Black Knight Inc. Thursday, alleging the tie-up would raise prices for mortgage lenders and home buyers.

title: Biden Meets Finland’s President to Discuss Ukraine, NATO Bid
description: Finnish President Sauli Niinisto said he discussed his nation’s bid to join NATO during an impromptu meeting with US President Joe Biden at the White House on Thursday.

title: Norfolk Southern Train Derails in Alabama Before CEO Testifies in Senate
description: A Norfolk Southern Corp. freight train derailed Thursday morning in eastern Alabama.

title: China Doesn’t Want a War Over Taiwan, US Spy Chief Haines Says
description: The US intelligence community assesses that China doesn’t want a military conflict over Taiwan even as it’s determined to bring the independently governed island under its control, officials told a House of Representatives hearing Thursday.

title: GOP Lawmaker Says He Was Victim of Improper US Intelligence Query
description: A top Republican on the House Intelligence Committee said he believes he was the subject of improper searches of data swept up by US intelligence agencies, as lawmakers from both parties said they will demand changes in a spy program that will expire unless Congress renews it this year.

title: Dutch Seek Middle Ground as US-China Chip Dispute Escalates
description: The Dutch are trying to find a middle ground between the US and China in an escalating battle over the world’s chip supply chain.

title: Biden’s NASA Budget Request Gives Boost to Artemis Moon-Return Program
description: The Biden administration is requesting $27.2 billion for NASA for its 2024 budget, with substantial funding for the space agency’s Artemis program, which aims to return humans to the moon this decade.

title: HS2 Delayed by Two Years Due to Rising Costs, UK Transport Secretary Says
description: Transport Secretary Mark Harper said he’s delaying construction of the Birmingham to Crewe leg of the UK’s high speed rail plan by two years after inflation pushed up costs.

title: Biden Budget Sees Inflation Cooling Further, Jobless Rate Climbing
description: President Joe Biden’s proposed budget expects inflation to cool further, but it predicts that the historically low US unemployment rate — which the administration has put at the heart of its economic appeal — will start to climb.

title: Biden Fires $6.9 Trillion Salvo to Open Budget Showdown With GOP
description: President Joe Biden unveiled a $6.9 trillion budget proposal on Thursday, a defiant opening salvo in high-stakes negotiations with congressional Republicans over the debt ceiling and government funding.

title: Zambia’s Auditor General Sichembe Arrested on Graft Charges
description: Zambia’s anti-graft agency arrested and charged the country’s auditor general, accusing him of engaging in corrupt practices involving more than 1.1 million kwacha ($54,475).

title: House Republicans Want Government Credit to Take Priority If Debt Limit Is Breached
description: House Republicans proposed ordering the US Treasury to prioritize payments on publicly held government debt and to Social Security beneficiaries in the event Congress fails to lift the federal debt limit.

title: Kenya Adopts UK-Style ‘Question Time’ to Keep Ministers Accountable
description: Kenyan ministers will now be required to appear before the National Assembly once a week to answer questions after lawmakers on Thursday adopted a new set of rules to hold them accountable.

title: PetSmart, Chewy Overlapping Directors Focus of DOJ Complaint
description: A worker advocacy group has asked the Justice Department to investigate BC Partners Holding Ltd.’s PetSmart LLC and Chewy Inc. over concerns the pet supply retailers’ overlapping directors violate US antitrust law.

title: UK Has £100 Billion For Budget Giveaways, Upbeat Forecaster Says
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt will have almost £100 billion ($119 billion) for giveaways in next week’s budget, a top economic forecaster said in a uniquely optimistic outlook.

title: Former Trump Official Launches Pro-DeSantis Super PAC
description: Former top Trump administration official Ken Cuccinelli announced the launch a super-PAC called “Never Back Down” to urge Florida Governor Ron DeSantis to run for president.

title: Hungary Spat Imperils EU’s Answer to China’s ‘Belt and Road’
description: The European Union’s global flagship infrastructure program is at risk of being undermined by Hungary’s moves to block a separate, but key, legal agreement.

title: US Sanctions Chinese Companies Supplying Iranian Maker of Drones Sold to Russia
description: The US Treasury Department imposed sanctions on five Chinese companies, and one person, accused of supplying aerospace components to an Iranian maker of drones sold to Russia and used in attacks on oil tankers.

title: Russia Still Uses ‘Toxic’ Euro, Dollar to Sell Nearly Half of Exports
description: Russia still conducted nearly half of all trade late last year in the currencies of its adversaries that imposed sanctions over the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine, even as the yuan and the ruble made deep inroads into the settlement of transactions.

title: Norfolk Southern Criticized for ‘Lack of Transparency’ After Ohio Crash
description: Norfolk Southern Corp. showed “an apparent lack of transparency” in the days after a train carrying toxic chemicals derailed in Ohio, the chairman of a Senate committee said Thursday in the first congressional hearing about last month’s accident.

title: New York City’s Pension-Fund System Plagued by Inefficiencies
description: New York City’s pension fund system for retired city workers is plagued by ballooning costs stemming from redundancies.

title: Trudeau’s Immigration Push Wins Support Despite Housing Crunch
description: A majority of Canadians sees increasing immigration as an economic boon, and nearly half support this year’s target, despite a housing shortage that threatens to further drive up real estate prices and rents.

title: Rishi Sunak’s ‘Stop the Boats’ Plans Welcomed by Far Right in Europe
description: Italian Deputy PM Matteo Salvini, who serves in Italy’s first far-right led government since World War II, and former French president candidate Eric Zemmour backed the British leader’s immigration plans.

title: After Critical Pope John Paul II Documentary, Poland Calls In US Ambassador
description: Poland’s Foreign Ministry called in the US ambassador days after a broadcaster owned by Warner Bros Discovery Inc. aired a documentary critical of the late Pope John Paul II, triggering outrage in the nation’s ruling party.

title: US and India Plan to Boost Chips Collaboration, Biden’s Commerce Chief Says
description: The US and India are signing a semiconductor collaboration agreement and discussing the best ways to coordinate their incentive plans and avoid over-subsidization for their industries, President Joe Biden’s commerce chief said.

title: Ex-Trump Lawyer Ellis Admits Twisting the Truth Over 2020 Election
description: Jenna Ellis, a lawyer who once described herself as part of an “elite strike force” fighting for Donald Trump, was formally censured by the Colorado Supreme Court after admitting to making 10 misrepresentations about the 2020 election.

title: In Biden’s Tax-the-Rich Budget, Capital-Gains Rates Near 45%
description: President Joe Biden is set to propose a series of tax increases on investors and top-earning Americans in his annual budget request to Congress.

title: Top Navalny Aide Apologizes After Supporting Sanctioned Tycoon
description: A top aide to jailed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny announced he will take a break from his work at the Anti-Corruption Foundation and apologized for writing a letter to the European Union asking for sanctions on billionaire Mikhail Fridman and his partners to be lifted.

title: Saudi Arabia and Russia Vaunt OPEC+ Ties, Discuss Ukraine
description: Saudi Arabia and Russia reaffirmed close cooperation in the OPEC+ oil cartel, and discussed Ukraine, grains and Syria at a foreign ministers’ meeting Thursday.

title: Ex-NATO General Becomes Czech President in Transatlantic Shift
description: A former NATO general was sworn in as the Czech Republic’s new president, marking the replacement of a divisive leader who promoted closer relations with China with one championing firmer transatlantic ties.

title: EU Hunt for Sanctioned Russian Billionaires’ Assets Stalls
description: The European Union is struggling to find and freeze the assets of sanctioned Russian billionaires, with the total figure increasing only modestly in recent months.

title: Washington Suffers as Federal Employees Work From Home
description: Quiet streets in downtown Washington, DC, have the city's Democratic mayor joining Republicans in a call to end teleworking.

title: Scenes From Protests in Georgia Against ‘Foreign Agents’ Law
description: Two nights of clashes between police and thousands of protesters in the Georgian capital, Tbilisi, prompted the ruling party on Thursday to abandon legislation targeting “foreign agents” that had been strongly criticized by the US and the European Union.

title: Paul Ryan Says to Expect a ‘Bumpy’ Ride to a Debt-Limit Deal
description: Former House Speaker Paul Ryan predicts that US lawmakers will reach a deal on raising the federal debt limit, but signaled investors should brace for a “bumpy” ride until that happens.

title: Germany May Have Identified Ship Involved in Nord Stream Bombing
description: German authorities said they searched a vessel that may have transported explosives used in the attack on the Nord Stream pipelines last year, signaling that an investigation may yield more on who was behind it.

title: Indonesia Tax Officials Under Fire as Suspect Deals Uncovered
description: Indonesia is cracking down on tax and customs agencies after uncovering billions of dollars in suspicious transactions made over the past 14 years, as public anger grows over these officials’ lavish displays of wealth.

title: Tunisia’s Leader Says He’s Not Racist, Cites Friendships
description: Tunisia’s president dismissed widespread criticism of his remarks on Black African migrants, telling a visiting West African counterpart unnamed officials and the media were to blame for trying to harm his country.

title: Putin Is Losing His Ex-Soviet Backyard
description: Signs of President Vladimir Putin’s waning power in what the Kremlin calls its “near abroad” of former Soviet republics are visible all around Russia’s borders.

title: North Korea Fires Missile After Warning US on Joint Drills
description: North Korea fired a suspected short-range ballistic missile after the influential sister of the state’s leader threatened the US with severe consequences if it goes ahead with joint military drills with South Korea.

title: Hungary Needs to Think Hard About Future Russia Relations, Orban Says
description: Hungary may need to re-think its cozy relationship with Russia in the future due to shifting geopolitical realities in the wake of Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.

title: Government Set to Announce HS2 Delays to Save Money, Report Says
description: The Government is expected to shortly announced that certain sections of HS2 will be delayed to save money, it has been reported.

title: South Korean President Plans First Visit to Japan in Four Years
description: South Korea’s leader will visit Japan for the first time since 2019, announcing a trip just days after the neighbors signaled a breakthrough to end a feud that had disrupted ties ranging from trade to security.

title: Israel Tensions Soar as Anti-Government Unrest Moves to Army
description: Tens of thousands are protesting over the Israeli government’s move to cut the power of the Supreme Court, escalating tensions over a plan that’s sparked the biggest unrest in decades and seen army reservists threatening to withhold service.

title: Hong Kong Makes First National Security Arrest in 10 Months
description: Hong Kong’s national security police detained a prominent pro-democracy activist on Thursday in the first reported arrest under the security law in about 10 months, according to local media reports.

title: Europe Set for Second Day of Snow as Cold Lingers Over Continent
description: A second day of snowy conditions is set to hit northern Europe and Scandinavia as a cold snap causes temperatures to plummet.

title: Gang Parties With 'Sports Cars and Attractive Women’ Spark Crackdown in Taiwan
description: Extravagant parties thrown by triads in Taiwan have spurred calls to crack down on organized crime, after viral videos of the events prompted concern about the power of gangs on the island.

title: Nigeria Delays Gubernatorial Vote by a Week After Court Ruling
description: Nigeria postponed gubernatorial and state legislative elections by a week to give the electoral commission more time to reconfigure electronic voter identification devices, after court hearings delayed the process.

title: Georgia Drops ‘Foreign Agent’ Law After Night of Violent Clashes
description: Georgia’s ruling party abandoned a draft law targeting “foreign agents” after a night of violent clashes between police and protesters in the capital, Tbilisi.

title: EBRD Pledges €1.5 Billion Support for Turkey’s Quake-Hit Region
description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development pledged as much as €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) in financial support to Turkey’s southeast over the next two years following last month’s devastating earthquakes.

title: Ukrainian Cities Hit by New Wave of Russian Missile Attacks
description: Russia launched its first massive missile attack in almost a month early Thursday against cities across Ukraine causing emergency power cut offs and train delays.

title: Ukraine Latest: Cities Across Country Face New Missile Attacks
description: Ukrainians awoke to a fresh wave of Russian missile attacks on Thursday morning and sirens were heard in many parts of the country. As in previous assaults, energy facilities were among the key targets, Ukrainian officials said.

title: Malaysia Ex-PM Likely to be Charged in Court on Friday: Bernama
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin is expected to be charged in court on Friday for corruption-related offenses, Bernama reported, citing the nation’s anti-graft authority.

title: Senate Minority Leader McConnell Is Hospitalized After Fall
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell was taken to a hospital on Wednesday night after a fall at a hotel, his office said in a brief statement.

title: Russian Cyberwar in Ukraine Stumbles Just Like Conventional One
description: The Russian cyber threat, like President Vladimir Putin’s army, was expected to overwhelm Ukraine’s capacities quickly.

title: Thai Developer Slumps as CEO Takes Leave to Join Politics
description: Shares of Thai property developer Sansiri Pcl tumbled after its Chief Executive Officer Srettha Thavisin said he was taking an unpaid sabbatical to focus on his new role as an adviser in the opposition Pheu Thai Party ahead of elections slated for May.

title: DeSantis Will Meet GOP Lawmakers in Iowa, a Crucial 2024 State
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis will meet with Iowa Republican legislators in Des Moines on Friday amid rising expectations that he will run for president in 2024, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Singapore Keen to Facilitate US-China Dialogue Amid Tensions
description: Singapore’s top trade official said the city-state is willing to facilitate a dialogue between the US and China to repair their relationship, as he described growing tensions between the world’s biggest economies as detrimental to the world.

title: Billionaire Ken Griffin Slammed in Testy Chicago Mayoral Debate
description: One of the hottest topics in the Chicago mayoral election is a person who doesn’t even live in the city anymore.

title: South Korean Leader Gets Much-Needed Boost With New Party Boss
description: South Korea’s ruling party elected as its new leader a candidate backed by President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is trying implement a historic deal to mend ties with Japan and win concessions from the US over export curbs that could hurt his country’s chipmakers.

title: Eberly Emerges as Frontrunner to Be Biden’s Fed Vice Chair Pick
description: Northwestern University Professor Janice Eberly is the frontrunner in the White House search for a successor to Lael Brainard as vice chair of the Federal Reserve, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Biden to Urge 25% Billionaire Tax, Levies on Rich Investors
description: President Joe Biden is proposing a series of new tax increases on billionaires, rich investors and corporations in his latest proposal for how Congress should prioritize taxes and spending.

title: Senate Passes Republican-Led Effort to Block DC Crime Bill
description: The Democratic-led Senate overwhelmingly voted to overturn a District of Columbia law that pares back penalties for some violent crimes, the latest sign of the party’s defensive position on crime and a blow to Washington statehood and home rule advocates.

title: 80 Former Congress Members Mishandled Classified Documents
description: Documents with classified markings were found mingled in material donated to libraries or universities by as many as 80 former members of Congress, the leaders of the House Intelligence Committee said Wednesday.
